Title: B2B Marketing and Lead Generation Specialist
Description:
About the job B2B Marketing and Lead Generation Specialist
|The Marketing and Lead Generation Specialist is responsible for growing new business in existing and new geographies. The main duty is to strategize and implement tactics that attract new business accounts. They report and coordinate with the Head of Business Development to reach out to potential clients and engage them through powerful content and marketing collateral.|Job Requirements |The right candidate|Should have at least 2+ years’ experience in Business Management Consulting, Quantitative Investment, Marketing or Strategy |Should be a structured thinker and is comfortable in highly quantitative and or technical business settings |Should have a proven interest in Marketing and Analytics. engineering and Quantitative Education is a plus|experience or Knowledge of Programmatic Marketing, Inbound lead generation and in B2B sales is a plus |Familiarity with Mixpanel, Google Analytics, Segment, Marketing automation tools is a plus  |Familiarity with scripts and libraries: Javascript, sql, python,pandas and spark is a plus|Key Responsibilities|Monitor the execution of the marketing and lead generation strategy of Vneuron across its different business lines and for multiple product offering |Own Vneuron’s inbound strategy including  content strategy across business lines, define, and monitor KPIs |Coordinate the creation of content such as white papers, research, reports, blog posts and other assets|Monitor Vneuron’s lead Generation funnel, implement tactics for converting traffic into leads |Analyze marketing effort return, optimize content, campaigns and technology to increase  the volume of leads while keeping cost of customer acquisition within the desired brackets |Work with sales team to qualify prospects and initiate engagement via telephone and mass email communication|Track all results and create a clear reporting system for management|Ensure new business goals are met monthly|Who You Are|High-energy personality with an infectiously positive attitude|Ambitious, motivated, and sales-minded|Someone who excels in a dynamic, results driven environment|A problem solver and critical thinker|Entrepreneurial|

Title: Front Desk Receptionist
Description: |About Four Seasons:|Four Seasons is powered by our people. We are a collective of individuals who crave to become better, to push ourselves to new heights and to treat each other as we wish to be treated in return. Our team members around the world create amazing experiences for our guests, residents, and partners through a commitment to luxury with genuine heart. We know that the best way to enable our people to deliver these exceptional guest experiences is through a world-class employee experience and company culture.|At Four Seasons, we believe in recognizing a familiar face, welcoming a new one and treating everyone we meet the way we would want to be treated ourselves. Whether you work with us, stay with us, live with us or discover with us, we believe our purpose is to create impressions that will stay with you for a lifetime. It comes from our belief that life is richer when we truly connect to the people and the world around us.|About the location:|Beachfront relaxation on north Africa’s Mediterranean coast. In the heart of Tunisia’s vibrant and exotic capital city, our modern Mediterranean oasis offers a calm, laid-back beachfront escape alongside this bustling business hub. Relax at our Spa and pools, stay connected with state-of-the-art business services, or take a step back in time – more than 3,000 years of ancient civilization are at your fingertips.|About the role:|The Front Desk Receptionist welcomes guests to the property, providing an exceptional guest experience at check-in, during the guest’s stay and on departure. This role works to achieve the highest level of guest satisfaction during their arrival and departure, plus responding to a wide variety of guest requests, assessing guest needs, adding personal recommendations, and aligning with Four Seasons service standards. This role is part of the front office department, reporting into the Front desk manager.| |What you will do:|Handles all guest interactions with the highest level of hospitality and professionalism, accommodating special requests whenever |possible|Assists|guests| in all inquiries in connection with hotel services, hours of operations, key hotel personnel, in-house events, directions, et|c.|Responds to all guest requests in |an accurate| and |timely| manner. Interaction|s| with guest will be in person and by |phone;|Resolves |guest| complaints|, and find opportunities to recognize and personalize the |service|experience for all guests |What you bring|:|2 |years e|xperience|working within a luxury| hotel or similar environment is |considered an |asset|Excellent interpersonal skills and |communication skills|Cross cultural sensitivity, and customer service orientation |Guest centricity and understanding the importance of guest’s preferences|.|  |What we offer: |•    Competitive Salary, wages, and a comprehensive benefits package|•    Excellent Training and Development opportunities|•    Complimentary Accommodation at other Four Seasons Hotels and Resort|•    Complimentary Dry Cleaning for Employee Uniforms|•    Complimentary Employee Meals| |Schedule & Hours:|48H|

Title: Systems Operations Analyst II
Description: |Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all fun. |#LI-RB1| |#LI-Hybrid|About the team:|The Operations Support team acts as a global team that ensures the support and integrity of FIS’s MarketMap Realtime, Valdi Global Market Platforms and Protegent.|The team is also responsible for second level support implementation. It drives internal implementation of projects and provide documentation.|Our products provide flexible, cost-efficient access to comprehensive, global, real-time and historical data, news and analytics in a lightweight application. Helps firms quickly expand the data managed by integrating data from such vendors as S&P, Thomson Reuters, IDC and MSCI. Our data integrity team works closely with our vendor partners to provide the cleanest data feed possible.|What you will be doing:|You will join an international team (Tunisia, France, Switzerland, USA) to support the client’s requests by:|Supporting over 120 stock exchanges|Ensuring real time server monitoring, availability and low latency for Market Data Servers.|Maintaining more than 850 customer accounts hosted on more than 200 servers|Our main stakeholders are CX teams, DEV teams, Network/Infra team, Exchanges Project managers, Trading teams|Ensure Advanced Technical support|Drive Platform enhancements Projects: 2 DataCenters, 3 HUBS, 350+ Windows/Linux Servers and 4500+ components|Plan/Deploy new releases.|Participate in Incident Management activities and Handle High Severity Incidents|What you bring:|Good knowledge of Windows Server|Good knowledge of Linux usage|Good experience in Incident Management and ITIL Process|New technologies discovery/learning|Good communication/human relationship|Good English level (sprint reviews, presentation, …)|Added bonus if you have:|MS Exchange Server knowledge|SQL Server knowledge|PowerShell scripting|What we offer you:|An attractive salary package and other bonuses as performance bonus, meals vouchers, transportation….|Attractive range of benefits including private medical cover, dental cover, and travel insurance.|Continuous development through our diversified training across core financial, sales and FIS solutions.|A modern, international work environment and a dedicated and motivated, supportive team.|A broad range of professional development possibilities, resources and opportunities|Privacy Statement|FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. Title: Software Engineering - PYTHON
Description: |iObeya|, c’est une aventure qui grandit depuis plus de 10 ans.|Notre secret : un esprit startup, |150 |personnes passionnées qui donnent le meilleur d’elles-mêmes dans un environnement de travail épanouissant, construit sur de fortes valeurs humaines et une ambition commune stimulante. | |Rejoindre iObeya, c’est participer à un projet d’entreprise en très forte croissance en France et à l’International. C’est travailler dans un cadre dynamique et une structure participative où chacun s’investit dans le développement de la vie de l'entreprise.| |En 10 ans, les solutions de Digital Visual Management d’iObeya ont déjà séduit plus de 400 grandes entreprises toutes industries confondues, dans plus de 30 pays et 500 000 utilisateurs quotidiens. Basées sur les pratiques Lean et Agile, iObeya révolutionne la gestion de la performance dans tous les départements de l’entreprise en donnant aux dirigeants, managers et opérateurs, le cockpit visuel temps réel. Aujourd’hui, notre objectif est de devenir le leader international du Management Visuel Digital.|Dans le cadre de cette volonté de forte croissance, nous recherchons un Software Engineering - Python motivé-e pour s’engager dans l’aventure iObeya, et pour voir le produit évoluer grâce à lui/elle.|Vos principales Missions/Responsabilités : |En collaboration avec l’équipe Intégrations, vous développerer des APIs de service autour de notre solution iObeya pour répondre à des besoins clients. |Vous participerez à l’analyse du besoin, conception, prototypage, développement et optimisation des APIs jusqu’à leur mise en production  |Assurer la qualité des réalisations en respectant les normes de développement, le processus de travail en équipe et de tests;   |Proposition de fonctionnalités innovantes  |Rédiger des documentations;  |Ce poste est pour vous si: |Vous avez une expérience confirmée de minimum 1 ans en tant que Software Engineer |Maîtrise les conceptes API Restful et de l’architectures micro-services |Bonne connaissance des chaînes d’intégration Gitlab et des concepts DevOps |Vous êtes rigoureux.se, polyvalent.e et autonome  |Vous êtes curieux de l’Intelligence artificelle (IA) dans des usages concrets. |Vous êtes force de proposition et assurez une régulière veille technologique |Vous accordez une grande importance sur la qualité de votre code et de vos livrables; |Vous aimez travailler en équipe, dans un contexte agile et challenging |Créer vous passionne; |Un profil Github ou toute démonstration d'un projet personnel serait un plus. |Poste en CDI|Poste à pourvoir immédiatement dans les bureaux de iObeya à Tunis aux berges du Lac avec un rythme de télétravail hybride.|

Title: Dir-Loss Prevention
Description: |Dir-Loss Prevention|JOB\_DESCRIPTION.SHARE.HTML Check out pictures from associates at this location, and some videos too!|JOB\_DESCRIPTION.SHARE.HTML |Marriott Hotels Resorts | Job Description|Job Number| 24074185 |Job Category| Loss Prevention & Security |Location| Tunis Marriott Hotel, Centre Urbain Nord, Tunis, Tunisia, Tunisia |Schedule| Full-Time |Position Type| Management |JOB SUMMARY|Manages security/loss prevention operations on a daily basis. Areas of responsibilities include protection of property assets, employees, guests and property, accident and fire prevention and response. Ensures that all areas of the property are safe and secure. Maintains logs, certifications and documents required by law and Standard Operating Procedures. Strives to continually improve guest and employee satisfaction while maximizing the financial performance of the department.|CANDIDATE PROFILE|Education and Experience|• High school diploma or GED; 4 years experience in the security/loss prevention or related professional area.|OR|• 2-year degree from an accredited university in Criminal Justice or related major; 2 years experience in the security/loss prevention or related professional area.|CORE WORK ACTIVITIES|Managing Security/Loss Prevention Operations|• Assists in the development and implementation of emergency procedures.|• Conducts investigation of all losses of property assets and refers to proper management for disposition.|• Deploys security staff to effectively monitor and protect property assets.|• Comply with all Corporate Loss Prevention safety and security management guidelines and procedures.|• Conduct periodic patrols of entire property and parking areas.|• Recognize success across areas of responsibility.|• Handles complaints, settling disputes, and resolving grievances and conflicts, or otherwise negotiating with others.|• Identifies and makes recommendations for minimizing physical hazards and unsafe work practices.|• Implements action plans to monitor and control risk.|• Maintains required reports and documentation regarding patrols of property and parking areas.|• Provides means for obtaining necessary medical attention on a timely basis.|Leading Security/Loss Prevention Teams|• Attends pre- and post-convention and weekly forecast meetings to understand group needs and gather critical information to communicate to Loss Prevention officers.|• Celebrates successes by publicly recognizing the contributions of team members.|• Communicates the importance of safety procedures, detailing procedure codes, ensuring employee understanding of safety codes, monitoring processes and procedures related to safety.|• Encourages and builds mutual trust, respect, and cooperation among team members.|• Identifies the developmental needs of others and coaching, mentoring, or otherwise helping others to improve their knowledge or skills.|• Provides guidance and direction to subordinates, including setting performance standards and monitoring performance.|• Provides personal assistance, medical attention, emotional support, or other personal care to others such as coworkers, customers, or patients.|• Serves as a role model to demonstrate appropriate behaviors.|• Solicits employee feedback, utilizes an "open door" policy and reviews employee satisfaction results to identify and address employee problems or concerns.|• Strives to improve service performance.|• Utilizes interpersonal and communication skills to lead, influence, and encourage others; advocates sound financial/business decision making; demonstrates honesty/integrity; leads by example.|Ensuring Exceptional Customer Service|• Displays leadership in guest hospitality, exemplifies excellent customer service and creates a positive atmosphere for guest relations.|• Empowers employees to provide excellent customer service.|• Meet quality standards and customer expectations on a daily basis.|• Incorporates guest safety and satisfaction as a component of departmental meetings with a focus on continuous improvement.|Conducting Human Resources Activities|• Assists in minimizing cost of accident claims through aggressive claims management.|• Brings issues to the attention of Human Resources as necessary.|• Completes proper documentation and reports all employee accident and general liability incidents to Claims Reporting Service.|• Conducts hourly employee performance appraisals according to Standard Operating Procedures.|• Complete disciplinary procedures and documentation according to Standard and Local Operating Procedures (SOPs and LSOPs) and support the Peer Review Process.|• Administer property policies fairly and consistently.|• Maintain first aid and CPR certifications required for Loss Prevention officers.|• Handles guest problems and complaints.|• Identifies the educational needs of others, developing formal educational or training programs or classes, and teaching or instructing others.|• Provides services that are above and beyond for customer satisfaction and retention.|Additional Responsibilities|• Analyzes information and evaluating results to choose the best solution and solve problems.|• Develops and maintains a working relationship with local law enforcement authorities.|• Informs and/or updates the executives, the peers and the subordinates on relevant information in a timely manner.|• Provides information to supervisors, co-workers, and subordinates by telephone, in written form, e-mail, or in person.|Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. Title: TU - HR Intern ( Internship)
Description: |TU - HR Intern ( Internship)|at Jumia Tunisia |About Jumia|:|Jumia believes that technology has the potential to transform everyday life in Africa for the better. Jumia was built to help consumers access millions of goods and services conveniently and at the best prices while opening up a new way for sellers to reach consumers and grow their businesses. |Listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in 2019, Jumia is the leading e-commerce company in Africa, operating in 11 countries. The Jumia platform consists of a marketplace, which connects sellers with consumers, a logistics service, which enables the shipment and delivery of packages from sellers to consumers, and a payment service, JumiaPay, which offers a safe and easy solution to facilitate online payment transactions. The company offers goods across a broad range of categories, such as phones and electronics, home appliances, fast-moving consumer goods, fashion and beauty.|The primary objective of the HR intern internship is to engage in a CSR project aimed at enabling the company to make meaningful contributions to the community and bolster its reputation beyond its primary business activities. |Key Responsibilities:| | Conduct in-depth research on best practices in Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) and industry trends. Analyze relevant policies, standards, and regulations related to CSR to inform company initiatives. Collaborate with internal teams to support the implementation of CSR programs, including projects related to environmental sustainability, diversity and inclusion, business ethics, etc. Contribute to data collection and analysis to assess the impact of CSR initiatives and prepare periodic reports. Assist in organizing internal and external events to raise awareness about CSR and encourage engagement with stakeholders. Aid in evaluating the progress and outcomes of CSR initiatives by collecting data, analyzing performance, and identifying improvement opportunities. Perform any other administrative tasks necessary to support the company's CSR activities.|Required skills| Strong research abilities to explore and understand best practices in CSR and industry trends. Knowledge of sustainability, diversity and inclusion, business ethics, and social impact principles. Analytical skills to assess policies, standards, and regulations pertinent to CSR initiatives. Effective communication and collaboration skills to work with internal teams and stakeholders. Data collection and analysis capabilities to evaluate the impact of CSR programs. Event planning and coordination skills to organize internal and external CSR awareness events.|We Offer|:| A unique experience in an entrepreneurial, yet structured environment A unique opportunity of having strong impact in building the African e-commerce sector The opportunity to become part of a highly professional and dynamic team An unparalleled personal and professional growth as our longer term objective is to train the next generation of leaders|Please ensure to only apply for jobs with Jumia through our official website.| |Jumia will never charge you a fee to apply for a job: be wary of websites that claim to help you apply for a Jumia job or that charge a fee to get you a job.|

Title: Goldstar Email/Escalations Respresentative- North America
Description: |Job Title:| Customer Success Specialist, North America Market|Report to: Success Team Lead (NA)|Required Language: Fluent English is essential|Overview of Role:| We are seeking a dynamic individual to join Goldstar’s North America customer success service team. As a Customer Success Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in building and maintaining strong relationships with our valued customers. Your primary responsibilities will include engaging with customers over the phone and by email, addressing their concerns, and ensuring their satisfaction with our products or services. The ideal candidate should possess exceptional communication skills, demonstrate proficiency in problem-solving, and exhibit a high level of confidence in handling challenging situations|Performing the role in line with the Goldstar Values:|Family - Treating our customers and our Goldstar team members like family|Simplicity - Ensuring all of our solutions we supply for our customers are easy with no hassle|Delighting our customers – We make sure every customer enjoys working with us by exceeding their expectations and providing the highest level of customer service and a quality product|Work hard, play hard - Work hard and give our all and at the same time love and enjoy what we do|Key Responsibilities:|(Including but not limited to)|1. Engage with our North America customers via phone calls and other communication channels to address inquiries, concerns, and feedback.|2. Build and nurture positive relationships with customers to enhance their overall experience with our company.|3. Effectively resolve customer issues and complaints in a timely and professional manner.|4. Collaborate with internal teams to escalate and follow up on customer inquiries, ensuring timely resolution.|5. Proactively identify opportunities to improve customer satisfaction and retention.|6. Provide product or service demonstrations and assistance to customers as needed.|7. Document customer interactions, feedback, and resolutions accurately in our CRM system.|8. Assist in developing and implementing customer success strategies and initiatives.|9. Ensure daily KPI’s are met|10. Actively participate in all training and development activities|11. Any other duties or activities as directed|What we need from you:|Previous experience|• 2+ years in a customer service role, or similar contact center role, is preferred|• Demonstrated previous measurable success in a care role is a distinct benefit|• Experience working with promotional merchandise distributors is also a plus, but not essential|Key Skills and Attributes| |• Customer-focused mindset with a passion for delivering exceptional service.|• Strong telephone manner: courteous, clear speech and the ability to gain the customers confidence over the telephone. Will not hesitate to pick up the phone, especially when there is a customer problem.|• Great problem solving skills and an ability to stay calm and professional under pressure|• Great listening skills and attention to detail is crucial. Demonstrated ability to understand the clients needs.|• A sense of urgency and the desire to respond quickly to customer requests, providing premium levels of service.|• Adaptability, flexibility and willingness to learn in a fast-paced environment|• Ambitious and driven, with an ability to work to targets/deadlines|• Computer literate, with good keyboard skills; familiar with different on-line database packages, and the Microsoft office Suite of products. Knowledge of Salesforce and Symbee Phone system are an advantage but not essential.|• Team Player with great organization skills and time management skills|• Fluent written and spoken English to a high standard is essential.|What we will provide:|• The opportunity for you to make a meaningful and serious contribution towards a very successful and rapidly growing business|• A supportive environment with opportunities to grow and develop your career|• A modern, fast paced and exciting company culture|About Goldstar;| |Goldstar is a trade supplier and part of the global National Pen Group, Goldstar is becoming famous for unbeatable value metal and full-colour writing instruments, combined with headache free all-inclusive pricing and a passionate team who will do whatever it takes to delight their customers. Goldstar’s mission is to become the best supplier in the industry and to make all distributors love Goldstar.|#On-site #LI-MT1|

Title: Bilingual Sales Admin Specialist (English and French) - Remote
Description:
About the job Bilingual Sales Admin Specialist (English and French) - Remote
|Job Description:|
|We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Bilingual Sales Admin Specialist to join our team. This position will be remote, and fluency in both English and French is required.|
|Responsibilities:|
|
|Provide administrative support to the sales team by preparing sales documents, contracts, and reports in both English and French.|
|Communicate with customers and clients in both languages to answer inquiries, provide information, and resolve issues.|

|
|Preferred Qualifications:|
|

|Experience working with and international environment.|
|Proficiency in other languages is a plus.|
|Knowledge of the recruitment industry is an advantage |
|
|Requirements:|
|
|Fluency in both English and French is essential.|

|Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.|
|Excellent communication skills in both languages, written and verbal.|
|Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite and CRM software.|
|Ability to work independently in a remote setting and collaborate effectively with a virtual team.|
|

Title: Sr. Paid Search Specialist - Spain remote (6-month contract)
Description: | Sr. Paid Search Specialist -Spain remote|Date: Apr 10, 2024 Location: Barcelona, B, ES, 08019 |Company: Vista |Who We Are:| |We are part of the Marketing organization at Vistaprint, belonging to the Integrated Media Team, where we are on the forefront of leveraging data and automation to maximize profit at desirable return on ad spend (ROAS) targets.|Our team is spread across the globe and is loaded with talent, with team members in Boston, Barcelona, London, Tunis, India and Sydney. We function as a centralized team, with our team members embedded in regional teams (NA, ANZ and EU). Your role will be predominantly supporting the EU Market. |Search and Shopping are a crucial component in Vistaprint’s success, and we’re uniquely positioned to give our customers what they want, when they want it, leveraging our scale to deliver incredible customer experiences.|We are seeking a Senior Paid Search Specialist to join our team remotely for a 7-month fixed-term contract. |What You Will Do:|● Be a part of the EU Regional Paid Search team – Manage campaigns across 3 of our European markets and support the rest of the team, while collaborating with colleagues in the EU team, to achieve our business goals. |● Identifying opportunities. You will be helping the team audit areas of opportunity within our accounts and executing against these opportunities to positively impact performance of the channel, in alignment with the company's marketing objectives and you will develop and execute comprehensive paid search strategies across various platforms, including Google Ads and Bing Ads. |● Lead Projects - Oversee and manage projects from inception to completion while ensuring project objectives are met and completed on time and that all deliverables are of the highest quality. |● Optimizing and testing. Apply your understanding of the competitive landscape, our customers’ needs, and current campaign performance to test new ideas for increasing profit and ROAS of our campaigns. |● Reporting on performance. Generate regular reports on your campaign performance, providing insights and recommendations for improvement for your markets as well as Projects that you lead for the team. |● Data-driven decisions. You adeptly handle key performance indicators, possess strong problem-solving and analytical skills, and excel in making decisions based on data. |● Delivering an exceptional customer experience through flawless operational execution. Your attention to detail is a strength you will bring to your role. |● Growing the business. You’ll work cross-functionally to unlock insights about customer behavior for other teams, and you’ll continue to leverage this data to grow not just Paid Search but also the business as a whole. |● Stay abreast of industry trends, best practices, and algorithm updates to ensure our campaigns remain competitive and effective.|Your Qualifications:|● 3+ years' experience in managing Search and Shopping campaigns.|● Complete command and mastery of Paid Search, including understanding of automated bidding, mastery of campaign management & account health, performance reporting and storytelling using data. |● Strong and willing team player, who isn’t afraid to help others succeed in addition to achieving their own success. |● Proficiency in Excel. You’re extremely comfortable using Excel.|● Autonomy in problem solving, breaking down larger problems and tasks into smaller increments of work to make progress more quickly. |● Is comfortable multi-tasking. You enjoy and can handle multiple projects at once. You deliver on timelines, set expectations with key stakeholders in your projects, and are comfortable tackling complex business tasks. |● Strong project management skills including ability to deliver requirements, write user-stories, manage stakeholder expectations, calculate and communicate impact Cost-of-Delay, and communicate clearly with stakeholders.|Useful Platform Experience:|● Google Ads, Looker, Products Up, Google Merchant Center, Google Tag Manager, Segment, Google Analytics.|Why You’ll Love Working Here:|We have a working culture where innovation is at the heart of everything that we do. You will be working in a truly global environment with an exceptionally talented and ambitious group in all areas of e-commerce. You will have a lot of fun working with people who are as energetic, smart, and driven as you are. We offer a competitive salary and benefits program. |Vistaprint is a Cimpress company passionate about empowering people to make an impression through individually meaningful, personalized physical products. We are a team of over 10,000 members in 24 countries working together to empower 17 million customers to make an impression. We are passionate, self-starting and audacious. We thrive in an entrepreneurial environment. Whatever geography we’re in, we bring exceptional talent together. We never stop learning and we believe you shouldn't either.|Equal Opportunity Employer (all Locations):|Vistaprint, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.|Job Segment:| Project Manager, Technology

Manages the technical/service relationship between the company and the customer, and between the company and subcontractors/vendors. Works with the key customers and/or internal businesses/end user representatives (Infrastructure Support Managers, Client Manager and the Account Delivery Manager) to retain customers and build the business. ITO Service Delivery work is generally performed remotely from the company facility, but may be performed at the customer’s location when required/justified. |Responsibilities:|· Apply technical knowledge to operate a technology area (e.g. server administration, technical security management, performance management) or customer group with moderate risk/complexity. |· Integrates technical knowledge and business understanding to create superior solutions for the company and for customers. |Incident Management: |· Resolve most technical incidents independently within your technical area. |· Work with team members to resolve more complex or cross-technology incidents. |Escalation Management: |· identify potential escalations and alert management proactively. |Problem Management: |· Begin to proactively and reactively provide solutions to prevent problems from occurring in area of responsibility. |Change Management/Implementation: |· Independently reviews, implements, and verifies changes/solutions of moderate complexity and risk to meet customer and/or trade/IT infrastructure needs within area(s) of technical responsibility. |Patch and Security Management: |· Apply and accurate. |· Solution Design: Applies the company solutions to meet moderately complex customer and/or trade/IT infrastructure needs within area(s) of technical responsibility. |Quality: |· projects from own responsibility area. |Customer Relationship Management: |· Balance internal needs with customers and/or internal businesses/end user's needs within defined parameters. |Teamwork: |· Work as part of a team, which may be virtual, global, and/or multi-functional. |· Seen as a resource to the team within area of technical responsibility. |Education and Experience Required:|· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field or equivalent work experience. |· May hold entry-level or intermediate-level certification(s) in work field. |· Typically Title: Quality Coach
Description: |Job Summary|This role is responsible for supporting process improvement initiatives by identifying trends and issues from data analysis and assisting in maintaining process quality and documentation. The role collaborates with engineers and experts to address performance anomalies and process failures, and conducts research on alternative solutions. The role facilitates project communications and stakeholder engagement to build relationships with internal project teams. The role also ensures compliance with audit and legislative requirements and generates documents as per project plans. This role will be mainly part of Printing Team.|Responsibilities: |Supports portions of initiatives involving one or more functions and project teams to drive process improvement for products or service offerings.|Collects, consolidates, and charts data from testing and process results for assigned portions of product and solution areas to identify trends and issues.|Assists in ensuring process quality through capturing good metrics, analyzing those metrics, supporting process creation and ensuring proper document and change control process.|Analyzes the work orders and cases to identify failures in process performance and process adherence to help identify the root causes of failures in process performance.|Works with factory engineers to identify performance anomalies through trend analysis, and collaborates with internal and external experts to generate solutions under the guidance of experienced team members.|Conducts research on alternative solutions to process problems, and determine proper approaches under the guidance of experienced team members.|Generates documentation in accordance with provided plan and detailed specifications, including budgets, resource allocation plans, and other support requirements.|Ensures audit, compliance and legislative requirements are adhered to and appropriate systems and controls are implemented as needed.|Supports project communications, including creation of status reports and summaries, tracking escalations and resolutions of issues, coordinating stakeholder meetings and updates, and updating documentation.|Develops understanding of and relationships with internal quality process improvement project teams.|Education and Experience| Recommended: |Four-year Degree in Quality Management, Business Administration, Engineering, Computer Sciences, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.|Typically has 0-2 years of work experience, preferably in quality, lean six sigma, or a related field.|Knowledge and Skills: |Agile Methodology|Auditing|Business Operations|Business Process|Business Requirements|Continuous Improvement Skills: |Effective Communication|Results Orientation|Learning Agility|Digital Fluency|Customer Centricity|Impact & Scope|Impacts own work and acts as a team member by providing information, analysis, Title: Quality Lab Specialist - Night Shift
Description: |At Henkel, you can build on a strong legacy and leading positions in both industrial and consumer businesses to reimagine and improve life every day. If you love challenging the status quo, join our community of over 50,000 pioneers around the globe. Our teams at Henkel Adhesive Technologies help to transform entire industries and provide our customers with a competitive advantage through adhesives, sealants and functional coatings. With our trusted brands, our cutting-edge technologies and our disruptive solutions, you will have countless opportunities to explore new paths and develop your skills. Grow within our future-led businesses, our diverse and vibrant culture and find a place where you simply belong. All to leave your mark for more sustainable growth.| |Dare to make an impact?| |YOUR ROLE| | |Conduct QC testing of pellet samples and molten samples| |Assist in quality investigations and perform double checks as needed| |Conduct periodic audits of the processes| |Comply with all safety, health, and environmental policies, procedures, and programs| |Determine what chemical adjustments need be made if product is out of specification, record the adjustments to be made and provide instruction to production associates on how to proceed. | |YOUR SKILLS | |Experience working in a quality lab using testing equipment.| |Associate or bachelor's degree preferred, but not required| |Must be able to handle multiple projects.| |Good observation skills.| |Good verbal and written communication skills.| |Proficient at basic mathematics, which includes addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and basic algebra.| |Computer skills, including SAP, Microsoft Office, Outlook preferred.| | |The pay rate for this role is $21/hour. This is the range that we in good faith anticipate relying on when setting wages for this position.  We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and this range.  This salary range may also be modified in the future.| |Henkel does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies. Unsolicited referrals and resumes are considered Henkel property and therefore, Henkel will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited referral. At Henkel's request only, preferred vendors may be invited to refer talent for specific open positions. In these cases, a fully-executed agreement with Henkel must be in place and current.| |All employees applying for an internal position must have a discussion with his/her manager about their interest in a job posting opportunity. The discussion will not preclude the employee from interviewing if their skills meet the job requirements.| |At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different races, colors, religions, sexes, national origins, disabilities, veteran statuses, ages, sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions, and other legally protected characteristics.|

Title: Contrôleur de Gestion (H/F)
Description:
Description de l'entreprise|Depuis plus de 30 ans, Lesaffre est impliqué dans le domaine de Santé & Nutrition humaine qui fait partie de son ambition de mieux nourrir et protéger la planète. En novembre 2018, Lesaffre a fait l’acquisition de Gnosis Advanced Biotech et l’a officiellement associé avec Lesaffre Human Care pour former une nouvelle Business Unit maintenant appelé Gnosis by Lesaffre.|
Chez Gnosis by Lesaffre, nous sommes engagés dans la culture et production d’actifs nutritionnels, probiotiques, levures nutritionnelles qui contribue à la santé humaine et au bien-être, à travers le pouvoir de microorganismes et de processus de biotransformation, comme la fermentation. Formulé différemment, nous explorons le vivant pour améliorer la vie.|
Notre vision : Chez Gnosis by Lesaffre, nous agissons pour un monde qui bouge mieux, digère mieux, vieillit mieux, se sent mieux, et en définitive, vit mieux, grâce aux microorganismes et la biotransformation.|Description du poste|Rattaché au Directeur Financier de la Société Rayen Food Industries, vos missions sont les suivantes : |- Assurer une bonne visibilité de la rentabilité de l’entreprise et aide à optimiser les coûts.|- Aider la direction générale à définir des objectifs réalistes de budget prévisionnel en s’appuyant sur les données provenant de différents services de l’entreprise (notamment les services commerciaux) et des études financières. |- Etablir la comptabilité analytique et le calcul des coûts de revient et alerter en cas de dépassement des budgets ou dérive des coûts.|- Animer le cycle budgétaire (élaboration et validation), suivre le respect des différents budgets et mettre en place les éléments du reporting interne et Groupe.|- Suivre périodiquement les budgets d’exploitation et d’investissement et inciter en permanence à l’optimisation des coûts.|- Prendre en charge la définition et la mise à jour des procédures de gestion de l'entreprise|- Déployer les activités d'audit interne et suivre l'efficacité et la fiabilité des contrôles.|- Dans le cadre du développement de l’activité d’audit interne, proposer des corrections et des modifications aux procédures afin de renforcer le dispositif de contrôle interne|- Etablir des tableaux de bord et des outils d'aide à la décision, et œuvrer à l'amélioration continue des analyses dans un objectif d'optimisation des résultats.|- Produire les reportings mensuels et annuels dans le respect des délais définis par la réglementation et le Groupe.|-  Accompagner la direction dans le cadre des différents projets de développement en œuvrant à fournir des informations financières fiables et utiles, ainsi qu'en proposant des actions à mettre en place pour remédier aux écarts éventuels.|- Réaliser les études financières et les simulations de coûts pour les nouveaux produits ou marchés.|- Coordonner les inventaires physiques inter-mettant et de fin d'année.|Qualifications| La fonction   nécessite une communication efficace avec sa direction mais également avec tous les autres services. |Traits de personnalité clé pour la réussite dans le poste :|Véritable esprit d’équipe|Dynamisme et enthousiasme|Sens des priorités et esprit d’initiative|Garder une vision business et recul sur les chiffres|Diplomatie dans les relations avec les autres services et filiales du groupe|Pragmatisme et flexibilité|
